info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:06PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lewis and Clark, southeastern Teton and northwestern Cascade Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 606 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Fort Shaw, or 13 miles northwest of Cascade, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Shaw, Fort Shaw, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Simms, Ulm and Sun River. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
